question:
Study the frequency of the following electromagnetic radiations and select the correct relationship :
I. : Infra-red
II. : Microwave
III. : Ultra-violet
explanation:
• Waves of infrared radiation are longer than those of visible light, according to the California Institute of Technology. IR frequencies range from about 3 gigahertz up to about 400 terahertz and wavelengths are estimated to range between 1,000 micrometers and 760 nanometers.
• Microwaves have frequencies ranging from about 1 billion cycles per second, or 1 gigahertz, up to about 300 gigahertz and wavelengths of about 30 centimeters to 1 millimeter.
• Ultraviolet light falls in the range of the EM spectrum between visible light and X-rays. It has frequencies of about 8 × 1014 to 3 × 1016 cycles per second and wavelengths of about 380 nanometers to about 10 nm.
